item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Horace Mann
item.description: "Do not think of knocking out another person's brains because he differs in opinion from you. It would be as rational to knock yourself on the head because you differ from yourself ten years ago." -- Horace Mann

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Arthur Hays Sulzberger
item.description: "I believe in an open mind, but not so open that your brains fall out." -- Arthur Hays Sulzberger

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "My task, which I am trying to achieve is, by the power of the written word, to make you hear, to make you feel--it is, before all, to make you see." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Robertson Davies
item.description: "A truly great book should be read in youth, again in maturity and once more in old age, as a fine building should be seen by morning light, at noon and by moonlight." -- Robertson Davies

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Karen Elizabeth Gordon
item.description: "All phone calls are obscene." -- Karen Elizabeth Gordon

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Our civilization is flinging itself to pieces. Stand back from the centrifuge." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Joseph Joubert
item.description: "The worst thing about new books is that they keep us from reading the old ones." -- Joseph Joubert

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Hakim Sanai
item.description: "This too shall pass." -- Hakim Sanai

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived. I did not wish to live what was not life, living is so dear; nor did I wish to practise resignation, unless it was quite necessary. I wanted to live deep and suck out all the marrow of life, to live so sturdily and Spartan-like as to put to rout all that was not life, to cut a broad swath and shave close, to drive life into a corner, and reduce it to its lowest terms." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Pat Conroy
item.description: "You get a little moody sometimes but I think that's because you like to read. People that like to read are always a little fucked up." -- Pat Conroy

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no oneâ€™s definition of your life; define yourself." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Kent M. Keith
item.description:
"The Paradoxical Commandments
People are illogical, unreasonable, and self-centered. Love them anyway.
If you do good, people will accuse you of selfish ulterior motives. Do good anyway.
If you are successful, you will win false friends and true enemies. Succeed anyway.
The good you do today will be forgotten tomorrow. Do good anyway.
Honesty and frankness make you vulnerable. Be honest and frank anyway.
The biggest men and women with the biggest ideas can be shot down by the smallest men and women with the smallest minds. Think big anyway.
People favor underdogs but follow only top dogs. Fight for a few underdogs anyway.
What you spend years building may be destroyed overnight. Build anyway.
People really need help but may attack you if you do help them. Help people anyway.
Give the world the best you have and you'll get kicked in the teeth. Give the world the best you have anyway." -- Kent M. Keith

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "But better to get hurt by the truth than comforted with a lie." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning..." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Henry Adams
item.description: "A teacher affects eternity; he can never tell where his influence stops." -- Henry Adams

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Bernard Malamud
item.description: "There comes a time in a man's life when to get where he has to go--if there are no doors or windows--he walks through a wall." -- Bernard Malamud

item.title: Mister Jones add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus
